message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE 

The paper deals with 3D shape reconstruction from 2D images using neural networks, which is a problem commonly studied in computer vision (cs.CV). The paper also discusses the use of shape encodings and recursive decomposition, which are topics relevant to computer graphics (cs.GR). The use of neural networks for pixel prediction is a common technique in machine learning (cs.LG), and the paper also discusses the use of shape similarity and sampling, which are topics relevant to artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and neural networks (cs.NE).
